comment: Great party game. Great opportunity for deception

Luck-based roll and move. Made obsolete by ‘Long Shot’.
Sounds like a good concept but too much dice rolling with people slowly moving around a track with very little happening. Boring.
Best with 6 (2-6) 90 mins, Age:12, 1.66 [$30] OOP, missing horses

Oh gawd. And we used to think this was a good game!

To be fair, it probably is to the right crowd. Now we find it a little processional with the excitement coming from bad dice rolls rather than clever choices.

Erm, seems a bit pointless. There's a lot of betting and other preparation and so-on, but then every single horse ends up failing or disqualified? Not inclined to play again. Redeeming feature: Nice horse figurines.

There's a lot of randomness in the game. Every move is dependent on a RANDOM die roll, some of the cards are much more powerful than others. You can avoid being on a fence but you cannot do anything if someone decides to trip your horse on a plain field. I suppose if everyone got the same set of cards, this could have been mitigated better, but no - you get three RANDOM cards. Lane position is also RANDOM every game. You might start every race from lane 1 while someone else could get stuck with lanes 5 and 6. Despite of that, the game could provide quite a few laughs if in the right group and everyone is in the right mood. Unfortunately, it's too long for what it is to attract multiple plays.
